VLIB_gauss5x5PyramidKernel_16

Detailed Description


Functions

int32_t VLIB_gauss5x5PyramidKernel_16 (const uint16_t *restrict pIn, const uint32_t *restrict pB, uint16_t width, uint16_t pitch, uint16_t height, uint16_t *restrict pOut)

Function Documentation

int32_t VLIB_gauss5x5PyramidKernel_16 ( const uint16_t *restrict  pIn,
const uint32_t *restrict  pB,
uint16_t  width,
uint16_t  pitch,
uint16_t  height,
uint16_t *restrict  pOut 
)

Description
This function can be used to calculate the next level of a pyramid. Given a pointer to a rectangular region of interest described by W (input data width), P (input data pitch), and H (input data height), this kernel returns (W-4)/2 x (H-3)/2 values. For example, if H=5, it will calculate a single row of results. The antialiasing filter used is a binomial approximation to the 5x5 Gaussian filter given by: 
        1   4   6   4   1
        4   16  24  16  4
        6   24  36  24  6   /   256
        4   16  24  16  4
        1   4   6   4   1
Parameters:
[in] *pIn Input image (UQ16.0)
[in] *pB 5 x (width-4) temporary array (not used) (UQ32.0)
[in] width Input width (UQ16.0)
[in] pitch Pitch of the input data (UQ16.0)
[in] height Input height (UQ16.0)
[out] *pOut Output image (UQ16.0)
Assumptions
  • *pB is deprecated in this version of the function (the _cn version uses this), can be set to 0.
  • (width-4) must be a multiple of 4
  • pitch should be greater than or equal to width
  • height must be greater than 4
  • pIn is a pointer to an (pitch x height) array of unsigned 16 bit data
  • pOut is a pointer to an (width-4)/2 x (height-3)/2 array of unsigned 16 bit data
Benchmarks:
See VLIB_Test_Report.html for cycle and memory information.
